#Text=Watford
#Text=Watford is one of the larger towns in Hertfordshire , England , and has approximately 80,000 citizens .
#Text=By road
#Text=Watford , like Hounslow & Waltham Cross , originally rose to prominence as a coaching town ( a kind of 18th-century motorway services ) because many roads pass through the area .
#Text=Non-Motorway Road Access
#Text=Watford , as a coaching town , has many road passing through it , but the fastest one is the A41 , a ' green ' ( semi-motorway ) A-road .
#Text=Exit at M1J5 ( A4008 ) or Hunton Bridge roundabout ( A411 ) .
#Text=M1
#Text=Watford
#Text=Herts is NOT near the Watford Gap :
#Text=that is named after Watford Northants .
#Text=Watford Herts is served by Junction ( 1|5 ) Watford , the 1st universal-access junction ( unless you count Junction ( 1|3 ) Scratchwood , which requires prior arrangement ) .
#Text=Leave at ( 1|5 ) Watford & take the A4008 .
#Text=M25
#Text=Take Junction ( 25|19 ) Hunton Bridge or ( 25|21A ) Bricket Wood East .
#Text=By rail
#Text=Watford Junction station .
#Text=Watford Junction is a large station that offers many connections .
#Text=Virgin Trains : Virgin Trains run express services on the West Coast Mainline & branches , some of them stopping at Watford Junction .
#Text=The service has buffet , Wi-Fi & at-seat electricity sockets .
#Text=They are more expensive than regular trains & do not sell tickets solely between London & Watford Junction , but are useful if travelling from further north .
#Text=London Midland : This regional rail provider serves Watford Junction with most trains .
#Text=Most of these go non-stop into London Euston , but the line has dedicated platforms at Bushey , Harrow & Wealdstone , Wembley Central & Queens Park .
#Text=A non-stop train will generally take 12 minutes .
#Text=They accept general tickets & Oyster cards .
#Text=London Overground : The Watford DC line of the London Overground runs local services to Watford every 10 minutes .
#Text=It serves Watford Junction & Watford High St.
#Text=These trains take a long time , but serve Willesden Junction , which is useful as an interchange , & have interchange with the Bakerloo line .
#Text=Watford High St. is closer to the town centre than Watford Junction & cheaper , as the boundary of zones 8 & 9A runs between the two stations .
#Text=Metropolitan Line :
#Text=The London Underground 's Metropolitan line runs from Watford station , actually located 0.8 miles away from the High St. in Cassiobury Park .

#Text=Direct trains run every 10 minutes to Baker St. ( Although an extension of the line though Watford High St , to Watford Junction has been formerly proposed , no firm date for construction or opening has been announced . )
#Text=By coach or canal
#Text=Frequent coaches serve Watford town centre from Heathrow Airport ( Bus 724 , 45 mins ) and Luton Airport ( Bus 321 , 1.5 hours ) .
#Text=The Grand Junction Canal also passes to the West of Watford , bordering Cassiobury Park .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Most attractions in Watford are within walking distance of each other and do not require buses or trains .
#Text=It is worth noting all Hertfordshire buses offer an ' Explorer ' ticket which permits a maximum of 2 adults , 2 adults and 2 children or 1 adult with 3 children to unlimited travel for £7 .
#Text=It is often worth doing as it can save money even if you are on your own .
#Text=See
#Text=Warner Bros. Studio Tour , ☏ 08450840900 ( high cost number ) .
#Text=Take a tour around the studios where Harry Potter was filmed and visit the large gift shop .
#Text=Buses to the studio can be taken from Watford Junction .
#Text=( must be purchased in advance , 2019 prices )
#Text=Adult : £45 , Child ( 5-15 years old ) : £37 , Infant ( 0-4 years ) : Free .
#Text=Watford Palace Theatre , ☏ +441923225671 .
#Text=Watford Museum , ☏ +441923232297 .
#Text=Watford Football Club .
#Text=They are one of the smaller clubs in English football but of late have seen their fortunes improve , returning to the premiership for the first time in 10 years .
#Text=Do
#Text=There are plenty of things to do in Watford .

#Text=For example , visit the Warner Bros Studios in north Watford , shop in the town centre , stroll through Cassiobury Park , play golf at Watford TopGolf or even visit Woodside Leisure Park , home of Vue cinema , indoor play areas and some restaurants .
#Text=Watford is also home to many leisure centres , for sporting activities , including a running and athletics track in Garston .
#Text=Watford Coloseum hosts many comedy shows and live music concerts , check out their website for upcoming shows .
#Text=Watch football ( ie soccer ) at Watford FC .
#Text=They play in the Premier League , the top tier of English football .
#Text=Their stadium ( capacity 21,500 ) is at Vicarage Road , half a mile west of town centre .
#Text=It 's shared with Saracens rugby club .
#Text=Buy
#Text=intu
#Text=Watford
#Text=( The Harlequin ) , 201 The Harlequin , Watford , WD17 2UB , ☏ +441923250292 , ✉ watford.information@intu.co.uk .

#Text=Mon - Wed 09:00 - 18:00 , Thu 09:00 - 21:00 , Fri 09:00 - 18:00 , Sat 09:00 - 19:00 , Sun 11:00-17:00. This is the main shopping mall with John Lewis , Jane Norman , French Connection Outlet , Monsoon and separate Accesorize in addition to Acessorize in the Monsoon , River Island , Anne Summers , La Senza , Zara , WHSmith ( post office at the back ) , Pineapple , Lush , GAME and many other shops .
#Text=There are also New Look , Topshop ( inc Topman ) , Computer Exchange , The End and Next to Choice ( a Next outlet )
#Text=on the High Street .
#Text=Eat
#Text=There are many choices .

#Text=For Restaurants , there is Middletons Steakhouse and Grill , Flower Drum ( Chinese ) , Flame ( Chinese buffet ) , various Pizza restaurants ( Pizza et pizza , Zinco , Ask , Pizza Hut , Pizza Express ) , Caribbean , Japanese ( Hanko ) ...

#Text=Fast food - Two McDonald 's ( With an extra 2 in the north of the town ) , Five Guys , two Subways , various pizza takeaway places ( Dominos , Pizza hut , Pizza express and various kebab shops .
#Text=Roosters Peri Peri Chicken is halal and serves very inexpensive but absolutely delicious chicken meals , including wraps , burgers , etc. and even apple pies and ice cream in the summer .
#Text=Try the chicken burger meal .
#Text=Yum .
#Text=For a sit down , go to Pepe 's , opposite the indoor market ( behind Poundland ) which serves Greek Cypriot fare as well as burgers , steaks , sandwiches , puddings etc.
#Text=Vegetarian - GoKula Vegetarian Cafe , a vegetarian and vegan fast food restaurant with links to the nearby Hari Krishna Temple .
#Text=A breakfast & brunch restaurant but not evenings .
#Text=At 65 Market Street .
#Text=Halal - Roosters ( burgers , chicken wings , chips ... ) , various kebab shops .
#Text=Cafés - Presence coffee shop with paninis , muffins , with a spa upstairs and a gift shop out front .
#Text=TJ Hughes has a restaurant/café .
#Text=For the more traditional fry up , head to Aroma at the bottom of the high street for relatively healthy and delicious breakfasts , chips , burgers etc.
#Text=Toast , next to Roosters and almost opposite the Palace Theatre , serves sandwiches , juice etc.
#Text=Try Go Kula cafe on Market Place for vegetarian food but it is a bit hit and miss .
#Text=Best to go there for a chat , read a few books and meet the local mums and toddlers .
#Text=The YMCA serves good food - it is behind Poundland/next to the indoor market .
#Text=Coffee
#Text=Starbucks and Costa in the Harlequin , Caffe Nero by St. Mary 's Church on the High Street , Presence in the north end of the High Street , McDonald 's on either end of the High Street .
#Text=Plenty of places with plenty of choice .
